title: Send trait bound failure error message doesn't refer to Send at all

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
If a trait method expects a `Future` to be `Send` but we try to use it for a `Future` that doesn't implement `Send`, the compiler error message doesn't mention the missing `Send` trait at all, which makes it very hard to debug the issue.

Example: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=53cdebbab43fa37326e73fe554de7db4

The error message:
```
   = note: the method `decorate` exists but the following trait bounds were not satisfied:
           `&dyn futures::future::Future<Error = (), Item = ()> : Decorate<_>`
           `&mut (dyn futures::future::Future<Error = (), Item = ()> + 'static) : Decorate<_>`
           `&mut std::boxed::Box<(dyn futures::future::Future<Error = (), Item = ()> + 'static)> : Decorate<_>`
           `&std::boxed::Box<dyn futures::future::Future<Error = (), Item = ()>> : Decorate<_>`
           `dyn futures::future::Future<Error = (), Item = ()> : Decorate<_>`
           `std::boxed::Box<dyn futures::future::Future<Error = (), Item = ()>> : Decorate<_>`
   = help: items from traits can only be used if the trait is implemented and in scope
   = note: the following trait defines an item `decorate`, perhaps you need to implement it:
           candidate #1: `Decorate`
```
